alert.note: Alert for Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Aroostook and north central Penobscot Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Island Falls to 7 miles southwest of Sherman Station. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houlton, Patten, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Smyrna, Amity, Mount Chase, Haynesville, Sherman Station, Cary Plantation, Smyrna Mills, southeastern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Littleton, Linneus, Oakfield, New Limerick, Ludlow, Stacyville and Merrill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 257 and 304. US Highway 1 between North Amity and Littleton. State Highway 11 between Stacyville and Patten. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
